metadata.titleEn: Genesis of Cretaceous ore bearing granites in North Huaiyang belt, northern margin of Dabie orogenic belt
metadata.description:
There are two kinds of data: Excel table and JPG model analysis chart.
The Excel data show that the major and trace elements of the whole rock were measured in the ALS laboratory group (Australian ICP-MS analysis laboratory in Guangzhou, China). The main elements were determined by X-ray fluorescence spectrometry (XRF).
Trace elements and rare earth elements were determined by element-2 mass spectrometer. The concentrations and isotopic ratios of Rb – Sr, SM – nd and u – th were determined by isotope dilution method. Zircon geochronology and Hf isotope data are also included.
The analysis data of JPG model include: 1. Geological map of Dabie orogenic belt showing early Cretaceous distribution; 2. Geological map of BHY shapinggou molybdenum deposit. 3. The geological section is magmatic rock and ore body of shapinggou molybdenum deposit. 4. According to the data of 313 geological team and Mineral Exploration Bureau of Anhui Provincial Bureau of geology, the sample position and the column section of the borehole are modified. 5. Geological map of Xianghongdian area. 6. Geological map of gongdongchong lead-zinc deposit (a) and A-B section of gongdongchong lead-zinc deposit 7. Zircon cathodoluminescence (CL) images of zircons from shapinggou granite porphyry and gongdongchong quartz monzonite porphyry. White and yellow circles represent the location of U-Pb dating and in site Hf isotope, respectively. The adjacent numbers are the analysis results. 8. Zircon U-Pb concordance map of shapinggou granite porphyry and gongdongchong quartz monzonite porphyry. 9. Chemical composition diagram of BHY ore bearing rocks. 10. (a) chondrite normalized REE patterns and (b) n-morb normalized multi-element spider diagram 11. Initial SR – Nd isotopic composition of ore bearing magmatic rocks in the BHY belt. 12. The initial lead isotopic composition of BHY ore bearing rocks. Ore bearing magmatic rocks include SPG, TJP, DG and QEC 13. Zircon U-Pb age (T) of BHY ore bearing rocks ε Hf（t）。  SiO2 and SiO2 ε Nd (T) nd (T) map of magmatic rocks in Dongchong mining area. 15. Production pattern of Mo Pb Zn granitic rocks in North Huaiyang area.
The database data can be used to study the mineralization and relationship of granite porphyry to molybdenite in shapinggou area.
metadata.instructions: File name: the sample data number is composed of, and the file name is "yyddbb", where YY represents the sampling year, DD represents the specific sampling location, and BB represents the sample number. For example, 17fd001-1 represents the first analytical data of the first sample collected from Feidong area in 17.

Example.Question: Can you provide an example of data collection methods used to analyze the mineral composition and isotopic ratios in Cretaceous granites in the North Huaiyang zone of the northern Dabie orogenic belt?
Example.Answer: An example of data collection methods includes measuring major elements using X-ray fluorescence (XRF) and trace elements using an ELEMENT-2 mass spectrometer at the ALS laboratory group, which is an Australian ICP-MS analysis lab located in Guangzhou, China. Isotope dilution methods were used to determine the concentrations and isotopic ratios of Rb–Sr, Sm–Nd, and U–Th. Additionally, zircon geochronology data and Hf isotope data were collected.

Feature Specification.Question: What characteristics are essential for datasets focused on the geochemical and isotopic composition of mineral-bearing granites in the northern margin of the Dabie orogenic belt?
Feature Specification.Answer: comprehensive data on whole rock major and trace elements, isotopic ratios, zircon U-Pb dating, in-situ Hf isotopic data, geological maps and models

Quantification.Question: How many types of elemental measurements are conducted in the data collection methods related to the 大别造山带北缘北淮阳带白垩纪含矿花岗岩的成因?

Definition.Question: What is the significance of using isotopic dilution in determining Rb–Sr, Sm–Nd, and U–Th concentrations and isotopic ratios in geological research?
Definition.Answer: Isotopic dilution is a method used to determine the concentrations and isotopic ratios of elements like Rb–Sr, Sm–Nd, and U–Th, which are crucial for understanding the age and genesis of geological formations. It involves adding a known quantity of isotopically enriched tracer to a sample, which allows for precise measurement of the elements and their isotopic ratios, providing insights into the mineralization processes and the geological history of regions such as the Dabaoshan orogenic belt.

Interpretation.Question: How can the integration of isotopic data, such as Rb-Sr, Sm-Nd, and U-Th concentrations, help infer the petrogenetic processes involved in the formation of mineralized granites in the Dabie Orogenic Belt?
Interpretation.Answer: Isotopic data provide insights into the age, origin, and evolution of rock units. By analyzing isotopic ratios and concentrations, researchers can trace the source materials and magma evolution processes that contributed to the formation of mineralized granites. This helps in understanding the petrogenetic history and the tectonic setting during the Cretaceous period in the Dabie Orogenic Belt.

Causal Antecedent.Question: What factors contribute to the development of data collection methods for analyzing the genesis of ore-bearing granites in the North Huaiyang Belt?
Causal Antecedent.Answer: The development of data collection methods for analyzing the genesis of ore-bearing granites in the North Huaiyang Belt is influenced by factors such as the need for accurate elemental and isotopic measurements, which are conducted using techniques like X-ray fluorescence spectroscopy (XRF) for major elements, ICP-MS for trace and rare earth elements, and isotope dilution methods for isotopic ratios. Additionally, geological mapping and sample positioning from drilling data, as well as zircon dating and isotope analysis, provide comprehensive data required for understanding the mineralization processes in the granite.

Causal Consequence.Question: What outcomes can be expected when using isotope dilution methods to determine Rb–Sr, Sm–Nd, and U–Th concentrations and isotope ratios in granite rock studies?
Causal Consequence.Answer: Using isotope dilution methods to determine Rb–Sr, Sm–Nd, and U–Th concentrations and isotope ratios allows for precise and accurate measurements of isotopic compositions, which can provide insights into the age, origin, and evolution of the granite rocks and their associated mineral deposits in the region.
